User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16
Build Identifier: Firefox/4.0

Firefox 4.0 Menu bar has Aero effect applied to it.  This makes the menu bar lables difficult to read.  Worse still: if the toolbar is customised and the Bookmarks Toolbar Items is on the Menu Bar, then the bookmarks text is hardly readable.
This bug was severe enough for me to downgrade to 3.6.16

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Firefox 4.0 on Window 7 64bit.
2. Enabled Aero Transparency effects.
3. Enable the Menu Bar.
4. Customise the menus by placing the "Bookmarks Toolbar Items" on the Menu Bar.

Actual Results:  
All text on the Menu Bar has the Aero effect applied to it making the text hard to read.


Expected Results:  
The Aero transparency effects should not be applied to a toolbar.
comments.creator: mik_wells@hotmail.com

comments.text:
I'm aware it's not a Firfox persona/theme.  It's an OS level effect which is being "incorrectly" applied to UI elements (the Menu Bar).  Normally, the Aero effect is only applied to the Title Bar and window borders. I know of no other Windows 7 application which applies the Aero effect to the menus and/or toolbars.

As a minimum, the Bookmark Toolbar Items could be rendered in the same style as the Menu Bar itself - as suggested above by AnthonyDa (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=645426#c4)

comments.text: Ideally, the Aero effect should only be applied to the Title Bar and window borders - not to the Toolbars. The only exception to this would be the Tabs toolbar when "Tabs on Top" is enabled.  This assumes that the Menu Bar appears *below* the Tabs when "Tabs on Tab" is enabled - which is not currently the case.
